intro: Spermacoce cyperoides, commonly known as the slender sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. Spermacoce cyperoides is often used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value in gardens.
